abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is unsatisfactory,
            though sustainability is likely, and institutional
            development impacts are modest. Lessons drawn from the
            project experience convey the following: 1) A project with
            mutually reinforcing components should secure financing of
            all components at the project's inception, i.e., when
            implementation of one, or more components is dependent on
            the completion, or substantial implementation of other
            components to succeed. In this case, while the design of the
            three mutually reinforcing components - on-lending to
            micro-enterprises, technical assistance (TA) to banks, and
            TA to micro-enterprises - was sound, its sequencing did not
            enable the TA components to be linked effectively with the
            on-lending component. Instead, coordination in the delivery
            of assistance should have ensured that training, and
            counseling services to be provided, reinforced and supported
            the small business lending programs. 2) Projects that are
            largely managed by the private sector, should require
            explicit arrangements with the borrower, in order to monitor
            social indicators, e.g., job creation. Such arrangements
            could have allowed better assessment of the public good
            element of the project, and ensured greater objectivity in
            assessing performance, since it can be argued that
            commercial banks have little incentive to collect, or
            intensively monitor job creation data. 3) Commitment by
            senior management of the participating banks was not secured
            at the outset (in spite of Bank discussions reiterating that
            further disbursements be conditional on actions by
            management, such as developing a project coordinating
            strategy), which precluded the full advantage of TA, and the
            appropriate focus on business actions.
